title: I Belong In Gold at Least : A video to learn from
body: Note: The video is not mine.

replies.body:
Nobody simply sits in fountain for a full minute unless:

1. The player has given up.
2. They have tremendous lag.
3. They have never played this champion before and cannot decide which items to buy.

In this case, it sounds like #2 seemed to be the case. A better internet speed would increase Nami's reaction time and allow her to leave base early. Bad computers can spit players up to a full minute late (and even more) into the game (which was probably the case in this game).
I think the full minute was divided up into smaller bits, 5-10 seconds in the fountain at a time, before minute 20.
That's why solo q is shit, cuz most players are like this Nami.

The PROBLEM with THAT statement, is that it can be interpreted almost the same as Nami's logic. "Most players are like Nami". Do you mean, "most players are bad" or "most players have poor attitudes/reasoning skills"? If it's the former, than your statement becomes;

"I hate solo q because I'm stuck with bad players who whine about being stuck with bad players". I s- waaaait a minute.
To be fair, he probably does belong in Gold at least. I see stuff like this quite often in there LMAO

Somewhere out there on youtube I bet there's a Vayne montage of this Nami's opponent.  Show's that there's two sides to every story.

Good stuff though, I wish more people watched their replays.

ppl pay for stuff like dis...

Dang. I wanna be critiqued but not really, cause I'm vain like that.

I've gotten players like this. Thankfully, I ignored their raging and just entertained them with positivity. You'd be surprised how much coaching a bad player can change the outlook of the game, but I don't do it where it seems like I'm angry so that I don't tilt said player further. I've won a lot of ranked games because of that one thing. I once had a team filled of like 3 toxic players and we ended up winning after my friend and I coached the team into making better plays. They were still salty and toxic in the end, but at least we won right? lol
There were like 0 wards from anyone on that team XD
